reference:
Exact coding issues/peculiarities are best addressed by reading the reference
article. To maximally reproduce the article's analyses, the user will need
to create some variables. The information is here, but you'll need to create
a variable for dyadic trade (and as a percentage of the subject's GDP),
GDP-adjusted imports, a means to filter out Israel from the analysis, and
some of the information reported in Table 1. However, I think this is a
learning experience for students.
description:
Description
A reduced form of data set for reproducing an analysis on the determinants
of Arab public opinion in seven countries toward 13 different countries.
title: Determinants of Arab Public Opinion

parameters.securtie: a dummy variable indicating at least an informal security tie between the subject and object
parameters.subgdp: the gross domestic product (GDP) of the subject
parameters.capobj: the composite index of national capabilities (capability ratio) of the object country
parameters.affect: an affect rating by the subject country to the object country
parameters.capsub: the composite index of national capabilities (capability ratio) of the subject country
parameters.objname: an ALL-CAPS English name for the target/object country
parameters.export: the volume of exports from the subject to the object
parameters.islam: a dummy variable that equals 1 if the object is a predominantly Muslim country
parameters.west: a dummy variable that equals 1 if the object ia a Western country
parameters.subjname: a three-character ISO code for the Arab (subject) country
parameters.import: the volume of imports to the subject from the object

format: A data frame with 91 observations on the following variables.
